alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND SOUTHEASTERN RED RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM CDT... At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Boxelder, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Foreman, Boxelder, De Kalb, Arkinda, Avery, Annona, Almont, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Harris, English, Wallace, Tom, and America. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Texas.
